oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Paul Chapel Missionary Baptist Church: commemorative plaque
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Paul Chapel Missionary Baptist Church
St. Paul Chapel Missionary Baptist Church, near Richardson's Landing, Dummonds Road, St. Paul, Tipton Co., TN

Color photograph of stone plaque on a yellow brick wall; reads "St. Paul Chapel M.B. CH. erected Aug. 9 1970; Deacons: Jessie Lawson - Chairman, William Russell, Robert Mebane, Peter Richardson, Sidney Thomas, Gilbert Heaston, Ben Ricks, L. Andre Richardson, Emmit Jones, John T. Tuggle; Trustees: Thomas Wakefield, Jethroe Jones, Andre Werry Jr.; Rev. S.P. Cole, Pastor; Burnester Richardson, Ch. Clerk; Dedicated Nov. 8 1981; Deacons: Jessie Lawson, Sidney Thomas, William Russell, Jessie Heaston, Gilbert Heaston, Eddie B. Woods, Lee Andrew Richardson, Robert Mebane; Rev. Allen Morris Jr., Pastor; Beulah Wakefield, Ch. Clerk."

St. Paul Chapel Missionary Baptist Church is an early Reconstruction era black settlement along the Mississippi River. The late 20th century property has an adjacent Rosenwald School building and a historic cemetery that contains at least one grave of a U.S. Colored Troops veteran. The cemetery also contains examples of folk art grave markers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings -- Tennessee
Historical markers
